questions.question: She was Apollo’s first love but, wishing to remain a virgin forever, she pleaded to her father and was transformed into a laurel tree.
What sorceress so enchanted Odysseus that he remained on her island of Aeaea for a full year?
Which of the centaurs, the only immortal one, was the wisest of them all?
What young man was the leader of the Quest for the Golden Fleece?
What woman boasted that she was more worthy of praise than Latona because her fourteen children outnumbered the goddess’ two? She was eventually turned into a weeping rock.

When Deucalion and Pyrrha asked the oracle of Themis for advice following the great deluge, they

options.A: Loosen the foot of their wineskin only after you reach the top of the mountain
options.B: Build an arc and take with you a pair of every animal you can find
options.C: Plant the seeds from the nearest tree at the foot of the mountain
options.D: Cast over your shoulders the bones of your mother

Hermes ordered him to not tell anyone what he had seen but, not trusting him, the god returned in disguise and asked the old man where the cattle went, promising a reward in return. When this old man told him what he saw, Hermes revealed himself and punished this man by turning him to stone:
